text: The 1967 Italian Athletics Championships was the 57th edition of the Italian Athletics Championships and were held in Bologna (track & field events). ==Champions== ===Men=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font-size:90%; text-align:left;" |- !Event !!Athlete !!Performance |- |100 metres|| Pasquale Giannattasio ||align=center|10.6 |- |200 metres|| Ippolito Giani ||align=center|21.3 |- |400 metres|| Sergio Bello ||align=center|48.4 |- |800 metres|| Francesco Bianchi ||align=center|1:48.7 |- |1500 metres|| Francesco Arese ||align=center|3:50.4 |- |5000 metres|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|14:18.4 |- |10,000 metres|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|29:44.0 |- |110 metres hurdles|| Eddy Ottoz ||align=center|13.9 |- |400 metres hurdles|| Alessandro Scatena ||align=center|52.6 |- |3000 metres steeplechase|| Giovanni Pizzi ||align=center|8:57.4 |- |High jump|| Vittoriano Drovandi ||align=center|2.08 |- |Pole vault|| Renato Dionisi ||align=center|4.40 |- |Long jump|| Pasquale Santoro ||align=center|7.46 |- |Triple jump|| Pierluigi Gatti ||align=center|15.57 |- |Shot put|| Silvano Meconi ||align=center|17.17 |- |Discus throw|| Silvano Simeon ||align=center|57.50 |- |Hammer throw|| Gian Paolo Urlando ||align=center|61.58 |- |Javelin throw|| Franco Radman ||align=center|75.12* |- |Decathlon|| Bruno Poserina ||align=center|6801 |- |Half Marathon|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|1:07:10 |- |Marathon|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center|02:27:04 |- |10,000 metres track walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|44:52.2 |- |20 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|01:33:09 |- |50 km road walk|| Abdon Pamich ||align=center|04:21:18 |- |Cross country (long course)|| Antonio Ambu ||align=center| |} ===Women=== {| class="wikitable" width=80% style="font- size:90%;
